str2: Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
A sword. Probably feminine of a presumed derivative of mache; a knife, i.e. Dirk; figuratively, war, judicial punishment.
From another form of the base of xestes; timber; by implication, a stick, club or tree or other wooden article or substance.
From sun and lambano; to clasp, i.e. Seize; specially, to conceive; by implication, to aid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A robber, brigand, bandit. From leizomai; a brigand.
